com.tarsec.javadoc.pdfdoclet.html
Class HTMLTag

java.lang.Object
  com.tarsec.javadoc.pdfdoclet.html.HTMLTag
All Implemented Interfaces:
IConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
TagA, TagB, TagBODY, TagBR, TagCENTER, TagCODE, TagDD, TagDIV, TagDL, TagDT, TagEM, TagH, TagHR, TagI, TagIMG, TagLI, TagOL, TagP, TagPRE, TagSTRIKE, TagSTRONG, TagTABLE, TagTD, TagTHEAD, TagTR, TagU, TagUL
public abstract class HTMLTag
extends java.lang.Object
implements IConstants

Base class for HTML tags. This class also includes the HTML parsing code.

Version:
$Revision: 1.15 $
Author:
Marcel Schoen

Constructor Detail

HTMLTag

public HTMLTag(HTMLTag parent,
               int type)
Creates a HTML tag object.

Parameters:
parent - The parent HTML tag object (or null).
type -
Method Detail

setParent

public void setParent(HTMLTag parent)
Sets the parent tag for this HTML tag. Which means that this tag is nested into the specified parent tag. This method also ensures that this tag inherits certain attributes from the parent tag (bold or italic text, link).

Parameters:
parent - The parent tag.

toPdfObjects

public com.lowagie.text.Element[] toPdfObjects()
Returns one or several PDF objects which best represent this HTML tag.

Returns:
The PDF element(s) for this HTML tag. May be null if there was a problem.

addNestedTagContent

public void addNestedTagContent(com.lowagie.text.Element[] elements)
Adds elements of a nested tag to the contents of this HTML tag.

Parameters:
elements - The PDF elements of the nexted tag.

toElement

public com.lowagie.text.Element toElement(java.lang.String text)
This method must be implemented by subclasses in order to provide a mechanism to convert an HTML tag into a PDF document object.

Parameters:
text - The text with HTML tags.
Returns:
The PDF Element representint that HTML code.

openTagElements

public com.lowagie.text.Element[] openTagElements()
Returns any number of PDF Elements preceeding a given HTML tag. For a H1-H6, for example, there will always be a preceeding Paragraph in order to provide some leading space. This default method returns no objects.

Returns:
Any number of PDF Elements (may be null).

closeTagElements

public com.lowagie.text.Element[] closeTagElements()
Returns any number of PDF Elements following a given HTML tag. For a H1-H6, for example, there will always be a Paragraph following in order to provide some additional space. This default method returns no objects.

Returns:
Any number of PDF Elements (may be null).

getLeading

public float getLeading()
Returns the leading for this type of HTML tag in the PDF document. For most tags it's just about the font size.

Returns:
The leading for this tag.

createParagraph

public com.lowagie.text.Paragraph createParagraph(java.lang.String content)
Creates a PDF Paragraph with the appropriate alignment and the default leading and correct font.

Parameters:
content - The text that goes into the Paragraph.
Returns:
The resulting PDF Paragraph object.

createParagraph

public com.lowagie.text.Paragraph createParagraph(com.lowagie.text.Chunk content)
Creates a PDF Paragraph with the appropriate alignment and the default leading and correct font.

Parameters:
content - The Chunk that goes into the Paragraph.
Returns:
The resulting PDF Paragraph object.

getFont

public com.lowagie.text.Font getFont()
Returns the appropriate PDF font for this HTML tag. The font is created based on the type and attributes of the tag.

Returns:
The PDF document font.

isItalic

public boolean isItalic()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is italic.

Returns:
True if it is italic, false if it's not.

isBold

public boolean isBold()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is bold.

Returns:
True if it is bold, false if it's not.

isPre

public boolean isPre()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is preformatted.

Returns:
True if it is preformatted, false if it's not.

isLink

public boolean isLink()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is a link.

Returns:
True if it is a link, false if it's not.

isUnderline

public boolean isUnderline()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is underlined.

Returns:
True if it is underlined, false if it's not.

isStrikethrough

public boolean isStrikethrough()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is strikethrough.

Returns:
True if it is strikethrough, false if it's not.

isCode

public boolean isCode()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is code.

Returns:
True if it is code, false if it's not.

isCentered

public boolean isCentered()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is aligned centered.

Returns:
True if it is aligned centered, false if it's not.

isRight

public boolean isRight()
Determines if the content text of this HTML tag is aligned right.

Returns:
True if it is aligned right, false if it's not.

getAttribute

protected java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String key)
Returns an attribute of this HTML tag. Attributes are optional values, like "border=.." for the "" tag.

Parameters:
key - The name of the attribute.
Returns:
The value of the attribute or null if no such attribute was found.

getContentTags

public java.util.ArrayList getContentTags()
Returns the tags contained within this HTML tag as an ArrayList.

Returns:
The contained tags.

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type of this HTML tag.

Returns:
The HTML tag type.

setAttribute

protected void setAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                            java.lang.String value)
Sets an attribute for this HTML tag object.

Parameters:
key - The name of the attribute.
value - The value of the attribute.
